g.text: Better hunting & gathering → more settled lifestyle
Ability to keep and domesticate animals that

text.tspan: herd animals' diseases often infect humans
→ advantages vs. cultures not previously exposed
between nomads grazing their herds in dry grasslands
and settled farmers in well watered areas
social hierarchy that humans can take over

g.text: Cows (c. 6500 BC) - hard to tame, but:
Horses (c. 3000 BC) when tamed and bred up in size:
can digest cellulose → make hilly land useful
